words.defineEn: (of a condition) dangerous, terrible, or uncertain
words.defineVi: (của một điều kiện) nguy hiểm, khủng khiếp, hoặc không chắc chắn

examples: 'Cause you know, he's obviously, you know a studious Yes, hardworking, hardworking guy, but I always picture that he's a little bit more like Stiles from Teen Wolf.
words.defineEn: hardworking, committed, and deeply engaged in the pursuit of a particular goal or objective
words.defineVi: chăm chỉ, cam kết và tham gia sâu vào việc theo đuổi một mục tiêu hoặc mục tiêu cụ thể

examples: The prestigious gala dinner is attended by business tycoons, philanthropists, and political leaders.
She attends a prestigious university known for its engineering program.
He belongs to a prestigious academic society that promotes scientific research.
Many actors dream of winning prestigious awards for their performances.
Europe is home to some of the world's oldest universities and prestigious educational institutions.
words.defineEn: exerting influence by reason of high status or prestige
words.defineVi: gây ảnh hưởng vì lý do địa vị cao hoặc uy tín
vô cùng đau buồn và nghiêm trọng

examples: That is just ludicrous.

Ludicrous Plus mode preps the battery for maximum performance by heating it to precisely 122 degrees to improve power output by about 46 horsepower, according to DragTimes' recent test of the latest firmware update.
Oh, those ludicrous handshaking errors we’ve all made.
But the not-so-secret sauce that propels the Model S to supercar performance and shaves off another 1.3 seconds is Ludicrous Plus mode and launch control.
words.defineEn: broadly or extravagantly humorous; resembling farce
words.defineVi: nói chung hoặc cực kỳ hài hước; giống như trò hề

examples: Hummingbirds are ravenous.
And they’re ravenous.
A ravenous snake that is capable of devouring an alligator.
They’re so ravenous, they’ve even been known to swim up into rivers to chase down food.
And it had lots of fish, too, of course, including one species so ravenous that it was known to swallow prey almost half the size of its entire body.
words.defineEn: devouring or craving food in great quantities
words.defineVi: ngấu nghiến hoặc thèm ăn với số lượng lớn

examples: And when England established its first successful long term colonies in North America in Virginia in 1607, they looked to mirror this pattern of enslavement with Native people, while also seeking copious amounts of silver and gold.
One of the nurses had this great idea to use one of her child's diapers to stop the copious head bleed.
words.defineEn: large in number or quantity (especially of discourse)
words.defineVi: lớn về số lượng hoặc số lượng (đặc biệt là diễn ngôn)

examples: It was a really audacious thing to do.
I was initially surprised, because it was really audacious.
[Narrator] When this audacious paint job was unveiled in the middle of up-market Kensington, it achieved instant notoriety and polarized opinions.
What federal resources can be brought to bear to help states with this very audacious goal of trying to conduct the largest vaccination campaign this country has ever done in modern history?
"Audacious" is a good term to apply to Biden back then.
words.defineEn: taking risks that are bold and shocking
words.defineVi: chấp nhận rủi ro táo bạo và gây sốc

examples: Cue the ominous music!
Boy, that sounds ominous.
It's an ominous name.
Now, after ominous warnings from law enforcement, the nation's capital and state capitals all over the country are on edge.
That went to an ominous place quickly.
There are a lot of different ethnicities in Oakland Chinatown, and, usually, it's very harmonious.
And the sum of all self-interests would make for a balanced, harmonious, and prosperous society.
Besides things like good health in a harmonious family life, individual happiness is affected by how beautiful you find the city you live in.
See how harmonious it is to bring people together as the whole.
Just to keep things harmonious, it's important when you work with your spouse to have a distinct division of labor.
words.defineEn: exhibiting equivalence or correspondence among constituents of an entity or between different entities
words.defineVi: thể hiện sự tương đương hoặc tương ứng giữa các thành phần của một thực thể hoặc giữa các thực thể khác nhau

examples: And, in retrospect, it was hideous.
- Look, the front door is hideous, isn't it?

words.defineEn: being extremely repulsive or shocking, evoking a sense of horror and violating standards of decency or morality
words.defineVi: cực kỳ ghê tởm hoặc gây sốc, gợi lên cảm giác kinh hoàng và vi phạm các tiêu chuẩn về phép lịch sự hoặc đạo đức

words.defineEn: causing offense or unhappiness due to being prejudice or unjust
words.defineVi: gây ra sự xúc phạm hoặc bất hạnh do thành kiến hoặc bất công

examples: Hot ash and noxious gas billow out in a wave known as a pyroclastic surge.

Then, shortly after that came World War I, which involved the widespread use of chemical weapons, including noxious gases.
It causes like a, noxious gas.
words.defineEn: injurious to physical or mental health
words.defineVi: gây tổn hại cho sức khỏe thể chất hoặc tinh thần

examples: But the dialogue is completely fictitious.
it's a fictitious force-- and that's not quite right.

I'm dubious.

Exactly, everything else is dubious and slimy and-

words.defineVi: có khả năng là không trung thực

examples: They feel like something the cat dragged in after a strenuous workout, sore and fatigued.
It's extremely strenuous.

So I figured out a lot of different ways to get point A to point B without a lot of strenuous movements.

words.defineEn: characterized by or performed with much energy or force
words.defineVi: đặc trưng bởi hoặc thực hiện với nhiều năng lượng hoặc lực lượng

examples: When he got back to London, Darwin wrote up his meticulous fieldnotes.
The near-weekly protests have also stood out for their meticulous organization.
I’m going to carry myself with kind of meticulous dignity.
That's the kind of meticulous coordination that happens in the background every step of the way.
but you can get as meticulous as you want, make little flossy strings.
words.defineEn: extremely careful and attentive to details
words.defineVi: cực kỳ cẩn thận và chú ý đến chi tiết
